title: Fading beauty: The protein degradation mechanism behind rose petal senescence
content: Sending a bouquet of roses to a loved one is a profoundly romantic gesture. While the desire for these beautiful blooms to last forever remains unattainable, the process of their natural fading can be prolonged. In this issue, Jingyun Lu, Guifang Zhang, and colleagues (Lu et al. 2024) provide a comprehensive understanding of how rose petal senescence is controlled at the molecular level. In their study, a new rose protein, SENESCENCE-ASSOCIATED F-BOX (RhSAF), was identified as a key player in mediating ethylene-induced petal senescence by destabilizing proteins involved in gibberellic acid (GA) signaling.
